intro: Gazania bracteata, commonly known as the golden gazania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow flowers with a distinctive central disc, surrounded by ray florets. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Gazania bracteata is known for its drought tolerance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
